intro: Pentaschistis, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa and consists of several species, most of which are annual or biennial herbs. The plants are characterized by their bright yellow or orange flowers, which are typically clustered in a composite head. They have alternate leaves that are usually lance-shaped and hairy, contributing to their distinctive appearance. Pentaschistis species are often found in open, disturbed habitats and are known for their medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
